 33 34 is to be  33 22    Sec. 68.  Section 123.177, subsection 1, Code 2018, is

 37 24 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
 37 25 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.
 37 26    This bill concerns alcoholic beverage control and matters
 37 27 under the purview of the alcoholic beverages division of the
 37 28 department of commerce.
 37 29    Code section 123.3, providing definitions, is amended.
 37 30 The bill adds a definition for "brewpub" which means a
 37 31 commercial establishment authorized to sell beer at retail
 37 32 for consumption on or off the premises that is operated by
 37 33 a retail class "C" liquor control licensee or class "B" beer
 37 34 permittee who also holds a special class "A" beer permit to
 37 35 manufacture and sell beer.  The bill also amends the definition
 38  1 of "broker" to provide that it also applies to a person who
 38  2 represents or promotes alcoholic liquor on behalf of a holder
 38  3 of a manufacturer's license or a class "A" native distilled
 38  4 spirits license.  The bill amends the definition of "alcoholic
 38  5 liquor" by striking the alternative term "intoxicating liquor".
 38  6 The bill further replaces the term "alcoholic liquor" for
 38  7 "intoxicating liquor" wherever the term appears in Code chapter
 38  8 123.
 38  9    Code section 123.4 is amended by substituting the defined
 38 10 term "alcoholic beverage" for the terms "beer, wine, and
 38 11 alcoholic liquor".  The term "alcoholic beverage" is defined to
 38 12 include beer, wine, and alcoholic liquor.
 38 13    Code section 123.9 is amended by striking the term "special
 38 14 permits" and by substituting the defined term "alcoholic
 38 15 beverage" for the terms "beer, wine, and alcoholic liquor".
 38 16    Code section 123.10 is amended by substituting the defined
 38 17 term "alcoholic beverage" for the terms "intoxicating liquor or
 38 18 beer".
 38 19    Code section 123.14 is amended by substituting the phrase
 38 20 "alcoholic beverage control" for the terms "intoxicating liquor
 38 21 or beer".
 38 22    Code section 123.23, concerning a distiller's certificate of
 38 23 compliance, is amended by substituting "alcoholic liquors" for
 38 24 "alcoholic beverages" as the section is limited to alcoholic
 38 25 liquor and is not applicable to wine or beer.
 38 26    Code section 123.25 is amended to provide that the
 38 27 consumption of any alcoholic beverages on the premises of the
 38 28 state=owned warehouse is prohibited, with the exception of
 38 29 alcoholic liquor that is consumed for sampling purposes.
 38 30    Code section 123.28, concerning the delivery of liquor
 38 31 purchased from class "E" liquor control license holders by
 38 32 certain liquor control licensees is amended to include class
 38 33 "C" native distilled spirits and class "D" liquor control
 38 34 licensees.  The section is also amended by striking a reference
 38 35 to special permits.
 39  1 Code section 123.30, concerning classes of liquor control
 39  2 licenses, is amended.  The bill authorizes a class "C" liquor
 39  3 control licensee to also hold a special class "A" beer permit
 39  4 for the purpose of operating a brewpub.  The bill also amends
 39  5 provisions relative to a class "E" liquor control license by
 39  6 providing that class "E" liquor control license holders are
 39  7 authorized to sell at retail to the public and to sell at
 39  8 wholesale to other retailers, provided they have been issued a
 39  9 basic permit by the alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of
 39 10 the United States department of the treasury.
 39 11    Code section 123.32, concerning action by local authorities
 39 12 and the division on applications for liquor control licenses,
 39 13 native distilled spirits licenses, and wine, and beer permits,
 39 14 is amended by striking three Code citations that reference the
 39 15 authority granted by various wine permits and replacing the
 39 16 reference with a Code reference that describes the application
 39 17 process for obtaining the permits.
 39 18    Code section 123.33, concerning records, is amended to
 39 19 allow licensees and permittees to keep records in printed or
 39 20 electronic format and not both.
 39 21    Code section 123.34, concerning the expiration of certain
 39 22 shorter term licenses and permits, is amended to allow the
 39 23 administrator to provide notice of expiration to licensees and
 39 24 permit holders electronically in lieu of written notice.
 39 25    Code section 123.36, concerning Sunday sales, is amended to
 39 26 provide that certain liquor control licensees are authorized
 39 27 to sell alcoholic beverages on Sunday as authorized by Code
 39 28 section 123.30.
 39 29    Code section 123.37 is amended by striking the terms "wine
 39 30 or beer" after the term "alcoholic beverages" as the term
 39 31 "alcoholic beverages" includes wine and beer.
 39 32    Code section 123.38 is amended by striking the term "special
 39 33 permits".
 39 34    Code section 123.39, concerning revocation or suspension of
 39 35 licenses or permits, is amended to refer to all liquor control
 40  1 licenses as the types of businesses that are required to report
 40  2 ownership changes to the local authority and the alcoholic
 40  3 beverages division and further provides that licensees
 40  4 shall report ownership changes in a manner prescribed by the
 40  5 administrator of the alcoholic beverages division within 30
 40  6 days of the change.
 40  7    Code section 123.41, concerning manufacturer's license for
 40  8 alcoholic liquor, is amended to provide that an applicant for
 40  9 a license file a basic permit issued to the applicant by the
 40 10 alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United States
 40 11 department of the treasury in lieu of a statement that proves
 40 12 status as a "bona fide manufacturer of alcohol liquors".
 40 13    Code section 123.42, concerning a broker's permit, is
 40 14 amended to provide that the broker list on the application
 40 15 for a permit shall list all manufacturers, distillers, and
 40 16 importers the applicant will represent and is further required
 40 17 to keep the list updated.
 40 18    Code section 123.44, prohibiting certain gifts of liquor, is
 40 19 amended by adding distiller and brewer to the list of persons
 40 20 who are prohibited from providing gifts of alcoholic beverages
 40 21 to the alcoholic beverages commission and employees of the
 40 22 alcoholic beverages division.
 40 23    Code sections 123.47 and 123.49 are amended by substituting
 40 24 the defined term "alcoholic beverage" or "alcoholic beverages"
 40 25 for the terms "beer, wine, and alcoholic liquor".
 40 26    Code section 123.50, concerning criminal and civil
 40 27 penalties, is amended by striking the terms "wine or beer"
 40 28 after the term "alcoholic beverage" as the term "alcoholic
 40 29 beverage" includes wine and beer.
 40 30    Code section 123.50A, concerning the alcohol compliance
 40 31 employee training program, is amended by striking the phrase
 40 32 "and federal liquor" in describing the subject matter of the
 40 33 state training program and by substituting the term "alcoholic
 40 34 beverages" for the terms "alcoholic liquor, wine, or beer".
 40 35    Code section 123.56, concerning native wines, is amended by
 41  1 striking the phrase "the class "A" wine permit" and inserting
 41  2 a reference to Code section 123.173 that addresses how native
 41  3 wine is sold to retailers.
 41  4    Code sections 123.81 and 123.84 are amended by adding the
 41  5 word "alcoholic" before the word "liquor".
 41  6    Code section 123.91 is amended by substituting the term
 41  7 "alcoholic liquors" for "intoxicating liquors".
 41  8    Code section 123.92, concerning dramshop liability, is
 41  9 amended by substituting "alcoholic beverage" for "beer, wine,
 41 10 or intoxicating liquors" within the section.
 41 11    Code section 123.98, concerning labeling shipments, is
 41 12 amended by adding the terms "wine or beer" and by substituting
 41 13 the term "alcoholic liquors" for "intoxicating liquors".
 41 14    Code sections 123.99, 123.100, 123.101, 123.103, 123.104,
 41 15 123.106, 123.107, 123.111, 123.115, 123.116, 123.119, 123.120,
 41 16 and 123.121 are amended by substituting the term "alcoholic
 41 17 liquor" for "intoxicating liquor" and "liquor".
 41 18    Code section 123.127, concerning class "A" and special class
 41 19 "A" beer permit application and issuance, is amended to provide
 41 20 that an applicant file a basic permit issued to the applicant
 41 21 by the alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United
 41 22 States department of the treasury.
 41 23    Code section 123.130, concerning authority under a class "A"
 41 24 and special class "A" beer permit, is amended to provide that
 41 25 a holder of a special class "A" beer permit may operate as a
 41 26 brewpub and that the authority of the permit is limited.
 41 27    Code section 123.131, concerning authority under a class "B"
 41 28 beer permit, is amended to specify how a class "B" beer permit
 41 29 holder may operate as a brewpub.
 41 30    Code section 123.139, concerning beer permits for separate
 41 31 locations, is amended to provide that each place of business
 41 32 where beer is manufactured requires a separate permit.
 41 33    Code section 123.173, concerning wine permits, is amended by
 41 34 adding class "D" liquor  control  licensee to the list of retail
 41 35 licensees that may purchase wine from a class "A" wine permit
 42  1 holder.
 42  2    Code section 123.175, concerning certain wine permit
 42  3 applications and issuance, is amended to provide that an
 42  4 applicant file a basic permit issued to the applicant by the
 42  5 alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United States
 42  6 department of the treasury.
 42  7    Code section 123.177, concerning class "A" wine permits, is
 42  8 amended to provide that each place of business where wine is
 42  9 manufactured requires a separate permit.
 42 10    Code section 123.181, concerning prohibited acts, is amended
 42 11 by providing that a class "A" wine permittee is prohibited from
 42 12 selling wine on credit to any retail licensee or permittee.
 42 13    Code section 123.186, concerning federal regulation adopted
 42 14 as rules, is amended to provide that a licensee or permittee
 42 15 who violates a rule adopted pursuant to the Code section is
 42 16 guilty of a violation of the Code section and subject to
 42 17 the general penalties provided in Code chapter 123 and the
 42 18 suspension, revocation, and civil penalty provisions of Code
 42 19 section 123.39.
 42 20    Code section 123.187, concerning direct shipment of wine, is
 42 21 amended.   The bill changes the wine direct shipper license to
 42 22 a permit and replaces the alcohol carrier license with a wine
 42 23 carrier permit.  The bill specifically provides that only a
 42 24 wine manufacturer that holds a wine direct shipper permit shall
 42 25 sell wine at retail for direct shipment to any person within
 42 26 this state and requires that an applicant for a wine direct
 42 27 shipper permit file the manufacturer's basic permit issued by
 42 28 the alcohol and tobacco, tax and trade bureau of the United
 42 29 States department of the treasury.  The bill also provides that
 42 30 a violation of this Code section shall subject the permittee
 42 31 to the general penalties provided in Code chapter 123 and the
 42 32 suspension, revocation, and civil penalty provisions of Code
 42 33 section 123.39.
       LSB 5286HV (2) 87
       ec/rn
 37 24 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
 37 25 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.
 37 26    This bill concerns alcoholic beverage control and matters
 37 27 under the purview of the alcoholic beverages division of the
 37 28 department of commerce.
 37 29    Code section 123.3, providing definitions, is amended.
 37 30 The bill adds a definition for "brewpub" which means a
 37 31 commercial establishment authorized to sell beer at retail
 37 32 for consumption on or off the premises that is operated by
 37 33 a retail class "C" liquor control licensee or class "B" beer
 37 34 permittee who also holds a special class "A" beer permit to
 37 35 manufacture and sell beer.  The bill also amends the definition
 38  1 of "broker" to provide that it also applies to a person who
 38  2 represents or promotes alcoholic liquor on behalf of a holder
 38  3 of a manufacturer's license or a class "A" native distilled
 38  4 spirits license.  The bill amends the definition of "alcoholic
 38  5 liquor" by striking the alternative term "intoxicating liquor".
 38  6 The bill further replaces the term "alcoholic liquor" for
 38  7 "intoxicating liquor" wherever the term appears in Code chapter
 38  8 123.
 38  9    Code section 123.4 is amended by substituting the defined
 38 10 term "alcoholic beverage" for the terms "beer, wine, and
 38 11 alcoholic liquor".  The term "alcoholic beverage" is defined to
 38 12 include beer, wine, and alcoholic liquor.
 38 13    Code section 123.9 is amended by striking the term "special
 38 14 permits" and by substituting the defined term "alcoholic
 38 15 beverage" for the terms "beer, wine, and alcoholic liquor".
 38 16    Code section 123.10 is amended by substituting the defined
 38 17 term "alcoholic beverage" for the terms "intoxicating liquor or
 38 18 beer".
 38 19    Code section 123.14 is amended by substituting the phrase
 38 20 "alcoholic beverage control" for the terms "intoxicating liquor
 38 21 or beer".
 38 22    Code section 123.23, concerning a distiller's certificate of
 38 23 compliance, is amended by substituting "alcoholic liquors" for
 38 24 "alcoholic beverages" as the section is limited to alcoholic
 38 25 liquor and is not applicable to wine or beer.
 38 26    Code section 123.25 is amended to provide that the
 38 27 consumption of any alcoholic beverages on the premises of the
 38 28 state=owned warehouse is prohibited, with the exception of
 38 29 alcoholic liquor that is consumed for sampling purposes.
 38 30    Code section 123.28, concerning the delivery of liquor
 38 31 purchased from class "E" liquor control license holders by
 38 32 certain liquor control licensees is amended to include class
 38 33 "C" native distilled spirits and class "D" liquor control
 38 34 licensees.  The section is also amended by striking a reference
 38 35 to special permits.
 39  1 Code section 123.30, concerning classes of liquor control
 39  2 licenses, is amended.  The bill authorizes a class "C" liquor
 39  3 control licensee to also hold a special class "A" beer permit
 39  4 for the purpose of operating a brewpub.  The bill also amends
 39  5 provisions relative to a class "E" liquor control license by
 39  6 providing that class "E" liquor control license holders are
 39  7 authorized to sell at retail to the public and to sell at
 39  8 wholesale to other retailers, provided they have been issued a
 39  9 basic permit by the alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of
 39 10 the United States department of the treasury.
 39 11    Code section 123.32, concerning action by local authorities
 39 12 and the division on applications for liquor control licenses,
 39 13 native distilled spirits licenses, and wine, and beer permits,
 39 14 is amended by striking three Code citations that reference the
 39 15 authority granted by various wine permits and replacing the
 39 16 reference with a Code reference that describes the application
 39 17 process for obtaining the permits.
 39 18    Code section 123.33, concerning records, is amended to
 39 19 allow licensees and permittees to keep records in printed or
 39 20 electronic format and not both.
 39 21    Code section 123.34, concerning the expiration of certain
 39 22 shorter term licenses and permits, is amended to allow the
 39 23 administrator to provide notice of expiration to licensees and
 39 24 permit holders electronically in lieu of written notice.
 39 25    Code section 123.36, concerning Sunday sales, is amended to
 39 26 provide that certain liquor control licensees are authorized
 39 27 to sell alcoholic beverages on Sunday as authorized by Code
 39 28 section 123.30.
 39 29    Code section 123.37 is amended by striking the terms "wine
 39 30 or beer" after the term "alcoholic beverages" as the term
 39 31 "alcoholic beverages" includes wine and beer.
 39 32    Code section 123.38 is amended by striking the term "special
 39 33 permits".
 39 34    Code section 123.39, concerning revocation or suspension of
 39 35 licenses or permits, is amended to refer to all liquor control
 40  1 licenses as the types of businesses that are required to report
 40  2 ownership changes to the local authority and the alcoholic
 40  3 beverages division and further provides that licensees
 40  4 shall report ownership changes in a manner prescribed by the
 40  5 administrator of the alcoholic beverages division within 30
 40  6 days of the change.
 40  7    Code section 123.41, concerning manufacturer's license for
 40  8 alcoholic liquor, is amended to provide that an applicant for
 40  9 a license file a basic permit issued to the applicant by the
 40 10 alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United States
 40 11 department of the treasury in lieu of a statement that proves
 40 12 status as a "bona fide manufacturer of alcohol liquors".
 40 13    Code section 123.42, concerning a broker's permit, is
 40 14 amended to provide that the broker list on the application
 40 15 for a permit shall list all manufacturers, distillers, and
 40 16 importers the applicant will represent and is further required
 40 17 to keep the list updated.
 40 18    Code section 123.44, prohibiting certain gifts of liquor, is
 40 19 amended by adding distiller and brewer to the list of persons
 40 20 who are prohibited from providing gifts of alcoholic beverages
 40 21 to the alcoholic beverages commission and employees of the
 40 22 alcoholic beverages division.
 40 23    Code sections 123.47 and 123.49 are amended by substituting
 40 24 the defined term "alcoholic beverage" or "alcoholic beverages"
 40 25 for the terms "beer, wine, and alcoholic liquor".
 40 26    Code section 123.50, concerning criminal and civil
 40 27 penalties, is amended by striking the terms "wine or beer"
 40 28 after the term "alcoholic beverage" as the term "alcoholic
 40 29 beverage" includes wine and beer.
 40 30    Code section 123.50A, concerning the alcohol compliance
 40 31 employee training program, is amended by striking the phrase
 40 32 "and federal liquor" in describing the subject matter of the
 40 33 state training program and by substituting the term "alcoholic
 40 34 beverages" for the terms "alcoholic liquor, wine, or beer".
 40 35    Code section 123.56, concerning native wines, is amended by
 41  1 striking the phrase "the class "A" wine permit" and inserting
 41  2 a reference to Code section 123.173 that addresses how native
 41  3 wine is sold to retailers.
 41  4    Code sections 123.81 and 123.84 are amended by adding the
 41  5 word "alcoholic" before the word "liquor".
 41  6    Code section 123.91 is amended by substituting the term
 41  7 "alcoholic liquors" for "intoxicating liquors".
 41  8    Code section 123.92, concerning dramshop liability, is
 41  9 amended by substituting "alcoholic beverage" for "beer, wine,
 41 10 or intoxicating liquors" within the section.
 41 11    Code section 123.98, concerning labeling shipments, is
 41 12 amended by adding the terms "wine or beer" and by substituting
 41 13 the term "alcoholic liquors" for "intoxicating liquors".
 41 14    Code sections 123.99, 123.100, 123.101, 123.103, 123.104,
 41 15 123.106, 123.107, 123.111, 123.115, 123.116, 123.119, 123.120,
 41 16 and 123.121 are amended by substituting the term "alcoholic
 41 17 liquor" for "intoxicating liquor" and "liquor".
 41 18    Code section 123.127, concerning class "A" and special class
 41 19 "A" beer permit application and issuance, is amended to provide
 41 20 that an applicant file a basic permit issued to the applicant
 41 21 by the alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United
 41 22 States department of the treasury.
 41 23    Code section 123.130, concerning authority under a class "A"
 41 24 and special class "A" beer permit, is amended to provide that
 41 25 a holder of a special class "A" beer permit may operate as a
 41 26 brewpub and that the authority of the permit is limited.
 41 27    Code section 123.131, concerning authority under a class "B"
 41 28 beer permit, is amended to specify how a class "B" beer permit
 41 29 holder may operate as a brewpub.
 41 30    Code section 123.139, concerning beer permits for separate
 41 31 locations, is amended to provide that each place of business
 41 32 where beer is manufactured requires a separate permit.
 41 33    Code section 123.173, concerning wine permits, is amended by
 41 34 adding class "D" liquor  control  licensee to the list of retail
 41 35 licensees that may purchase wine from a class "A" wine permit
 42  1 holder.
 42  2    Code section 123.175, concerning certain wine permit
 42  3 applications and issuance, is amended to provide that an
 42  4 applicant file a basic permit issued to the applicant by the
 42  5 alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United States
 42  6 department of the treasury.
 42  7    Code section 123.177, concerning class "A" wine permits, is
 42  8 amended to provide that each place of business where wine is
 42  9 manufactured requires a separate permit.
 42 10    Code section 123.181, concerning prohibited acts, is amended
 42 11 by providing that a class "A" wine permittee is prohibited from
 42 12 selling wine on credit to any retail licensee or permittee.
 42 13    Code section 123.186, concerning federal regulation adopted
 42 14 as rules, is amended to provide that a licensee or permittee
 42 15 who violates a rule adopted pursuant to the Code section is
 42 16 guilty of a violation of the Code section and subject to
 42 17 the general penalties provided in Code chapter 123 and the
 42 18 suspension, revocation, and civil penalty provisions of Code
 42 19 section 123.39.
 42 20    Code section 123.187, concerning direct shipment of wine, is
 42 21 amended.   The bill changes the wine direct shipper license to

 41  8    Code section 123.92, concerning dramshop liability, is
 41  9 amended by substituting "alcoholic beverage" for "beer, wine,
 41 10 or intoxicating liquors" within the section.
 41 11    Code section 123.98, concerning labeling shipments, is
 41 12 amended by adding the terms "wine or beer" and by substituting
 41 13 the term "alcoholic liquors" for "intoxicating liquors".
 41 14    Code sections 123.99, 123.100, 123.101, 123.103, 123.104,
 41 15 123.106, 123.107, 123.111, 123.115, 123.116, 123.119, 123.120,
 41 16 and 123.121 are amended by substituting the term "alcoholic
 41 17 liquor" for "intoxicating liquor" and "liquor".
 41 18    Code section 123.127, concerning class "A" and special class
 41 19 "A" beer permit application and issuance, is amended to provide
 41 20 that an applicant file a basic permit issued to the applicant
 41 21 by the alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United
 41 22 States department of the treasury.
 41 23    Code section 123.130, concerning authority under a class "A"
 41 24 and special class "A" beer permit, is amended to provide that
 41 25 a holder of a special class "A" beer permit may operate as a
 41 26 brewpub and that the authority of the permit is limited.
 41 27    Code section 123.131, concerning authority under a class "B"
 41 28 beer permit, is amended to specify how a class "B" beer permit
 41 29 holder may operate as a brewpub.
 41 30    Code section 123.139, concerning beer permits for separate
 41 31 locations, is amended to provide that each place of business
 41 32 where beer is manufactured requires a separate permit.
 41 33    Code section 123.173, concerning wine permits, is amended by
 41 34 adding class "D" liquor  control  licensee to the list of retail
 41 35 licensees that may purchase wine from a class "A" wine permit
 42  1 holder.
 42  2    Code section 123.175, concerning certain wine permit
 42  3 applications and issuance, is amended to provide that an
 42  4 applicant file a basic permit issued to the applicant by the
 42  5 alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United States
 42  6 department of the treasury.
 42  7    Code section 123.177, concerning class "A" wine permits, is
 42  8 amended to provide that each place of business where wine is
 42  9 manufactured requires a separate permit.
 42 10    Code section 123.181, concerning prohibited acts, is amended
 42 11 by providing that a class "A" wine permittee is prohibited from
 42 12 selling wine on credit to any retail licensee or permittee.
 42 13    Code section 123.186, concerning federal regulation adopted
 42 14 as rules, is amended to provide that a licensee or permittee
 42 15 who violates a rule adopted pursuant to the Code section is
 42 16 guilty of a violation of the Code section and subject to
 42 17 the general penalties provided in Code chapter 123 and the
 42 18 suspension, revocation, and civil penalty provisions of Code
 42 19 section 123.39.
 42 20    Code section 123.187, concerning direct shipment of wine, is
 42 21 amended.   The bill changes the wine direct shipper license to
 42 22 a permit and replaces the alcohol carrier license with a wine
 42 23 carrier permit.  The bill specifically provides that only a
 42 24 wine manufacturer that holds a wine direct shipper permit shall
 42 25 sell wine at retail for direct shipment to any person within
 42 26 this state and requires that an applicant for a wine direct
 42 27 shipper permit file the manufacturer's basic permit issued by
 42 28 the alcohol and tobacco, tax and trade bureau of the United
 42 29 States department of the treasury.  The bill also provides that
 42 30 a violation of this Code section shall subject the permittee
 42 31 to the general penalties provided in Code chapter 123 and the
 42 32 suspension, revocation, and civil penalty provisions of Code
 42 33 section 123.39.

 37 27 under the purview of the alcoholic beverages division of the

 37 29    Code section 123.3, providing definitions, is amended.
 37 30 The bill adds a definition for "brewpub" which means a
 37 31 commercial establishment authorized to sell beer at retail
 37 32 for consumption on or off the premises that is operated by
 37 33 a retail class "C" liquor control licensee or class "B" beer
 37 34 permittee who also holds a special class "A" beer permit to
 37 35 manufacture and sell beer.  The bill also amends the definition
 38  1 of "broker" to provide that it also applies to a person who
 38  2 represents or promotes alcoholic liquor on behalf of a holder
 38  3 of a manufacturer's license or a class "A" native distilled
 38  4 spirits license.  The bill amends the definition of "alcoholic
 38  5 liquor" by striking the alternative term "intoxicating liquor".
 38  6 The bill further replaces the term "alcoholic liquor" for
 38  7 "intoxicating liquor" wherever the term appears in Code chapter
 38  8 123.
 38  9    Code section 123.4 is amended by substituting the defined
 38 10 term "alcoholic beverage" for the terms "beer, wine, and
 38 11 alcoholic liquor".  The term "alcoholic beverage" is defined to
 38 12 include beer, wine, and alcoholic liquor.
 38 13    Code section 123.9 is amended by striking the term "special
 38 14 permits" and by substituting the defined term "alcoholic
 38 15 beverage" for the terms "beer, wine, and alcoholic liquor".
 38 16    Code section 123.10 is amended by substituting the defined
 38 17 term "alcoholic beverage" for the terms "intoxicating liquor or
 38 18 beer".
 38 19    Code section 123.14 is amended by substituting the phrase
 38 20 "alcoholic beverage control" for the terms "intoxicating liquor
 38 21 or beer".
 38 22    Code section 123.23, concerning a distiller's certificate of
 38 23 compliance, is amended by substituting "alcoholic liquors" for
 38 24 "alcoholic beverages" as the section is limited to alcoholic
 38 25 liquor and is not applicable to wine or beer.
 38 26    Code section 123.25 is amended to provide that the
 38 27 consumption of any alcoholic beverages on the premises of the
 38 28 state=owned warehouse is prohibited, with the exception of
 38 29 alcoholic liquor that is consumed for sampling purposes.
 38 30    Code section 123.28, concerning the delivery of liquor
 38 31 purchased from class "E" liquor control license holders by
 38 32 certain liquor control licensees is amended to include class
 38 33 "C" native distilled spirits and class "D" liquor control
 38 34 licensees.  The section is also amended by striking a reference
 38 35 to special permits.
 39  1 Code section 123.30, concerning classes of liquor control
 39  2 licenses, is amended.  The bill authorizes a class "C" liquor
 39  3 control licensee to also hold a special class "A" beer permit
 39  4 for the purpose of operating a brewpub.  The bill also amends
 39  5 provisions relative to a class "E" liquor control license by
 39  6 providing that class "E" liquor control license holders are
 39  7 authorized to sell at retail to the public and to sell at
 39  8 wholesale to other retailers, provided they have been issued a
 39  9 basic permit by the alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of
 39 10 the United States department of the treasury.
 39 11    Code section 123.32, concerning action by local authorities
 39 12 and the division on applications for liquor control licenses,
 39 13 native distilled spirits licenses, and wine, and beer permits,
 39 14 is amended by striking three Code citations that reference the
 39 15 authority granted by various wine permits and replacing the
 39 16 reference with a Code reference that describes the application
 39 17 process for obtaining the permits.
 39 18    Code section 123.33, concerning records, is amended to
 39 19 allow licensees and permittees to keep records in printed or
 39 20 electronic format and not both.
 39 21    Code section 123.34, concerning the expiration of certain
 39 22 shorter term licenses and permits, is amended to allow the
 39 23 administrator to provide notice of expiration to licensees and
 39 24 permit holders electronically in lieu of written notice.
 39 25    Code section 123.36, concerning Sunday sales, is amended to
 39 26 provide that certain liquor control licensees are authorized
 39 27 to sell alcoholic beverages on Sunday as authorized by Code
 39 28 section 123.30.
 39 29    Code section 123.37 is amended by striking the terms "wine
 39 30 or beer" after the term "alcoholic beverages" as the term
 39 31 "alcoholic beverages" includes wine and beer.
 39 32    Code section 123.38 is amended by striking the term "special
 39 33 permits".
 39 34    Code section 123.39, concerning revocation or suspension of
 39 35 licenses or permits, is amended to refer to all liquor control
 40  1 licenses as the types of businesses that are required to report
 40  2 ownership changes to the local authority and the alcoholic
 40  3 beverages division and further provides that licensees
 40  4 shall report ownership changes in a manner prescribed by the
 40  5 administrator of the alcoholic beverages division within 30
 40  6 days of the change.
 40  7    Code section 123.41, concerning manufacturer's license for
 40  8 alcoholic liquor, is amended to provide that an applicant for
 40  9 a license file a basic permit issued to the applicant by the
 40 10 alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United States
 40 11 department of the treasury in lieu of a statement that proves
 40 12 status as a "bona fide manufacturer of alcohol liquors".
 40 13    Code section 123.42, concerning a broker's permit, is
 40 14 amended to provide that the broker list on the application
 40 15 for a permit shall list all manufacturers, distillers, and
 40 16 importers the applicant will represent and is further required
 40 17 to keep the list updated.
 40 18    Code section 123.44, prohibiting certain gifts of liquor, is
 40 19 amended by adding distiller and brewer to the list of persons
 40 20 who are prohibited from providing gifts of alcoholic beverages
 40 21 to the alcoholic beverages commission and employees of the
 40 22 alcoholic beverages division.
 40 23    Code sections 123.47 and 123.49 are amended by substituting
 40 24 the defined term "alcoholic beverage" or "alcoholic beverages"
 40 25 for the terms "beer, wine, and alcoholic liquor".
 40 26    Code section 123.50, concerning criminal and civil
 40 27 penalties, is amended by striking the terms "wine or beer"
 40 28 after the term "alcoholic beverage" as the term "alcoholic
 40 29 beverage" includes wine and beer.
 40 30    Code section 123.50A, concerning the alcohol compliance
 40 31 employee training program, is amended by striking the phrase
 40 32 "and federal liquor" in describing the subject matter of the
 40 33 state training program and by substituting the term "alcoholic
 40 34 beverages" for the terms "alcoholic liquor, wine, or beer".

 40 11 department of the treasury in lieu of a statement that proves
 40 12 status as a "bona fide manufacturer of alcohol liquors".
 40 13    Code section 123.42, concerning a broker's permit, is
 40 14 amended to provide that the broker list on the application
 40 15 for a permit shall list all manufacturers, distillers, and
 40 16 importers the applicant will represent and is further required
 40 17 to keep the list updated.
 40 18    Code section 123.44, prohibiting certain gifts of liquor, is
 40 19 amended by adding distiller and brewer to the list of persons
 40 20 who are prohibited from providing gifts of alcoholic beverages
 40 21 to the alcoholic beverages commission and employees of the
 40 22 alcoholic beverages division.
 40 23    Code sections 123.47 and 123.49 are amended by substituting
 40 24 the defined term "alcoholic beverage" or "alcoholic beverages"
 40 25 for the terms "beer, wine, and alcoholic liquor".
 40 26    Code section 123.50, concerning criminal and civil
 40 27 penalties, is amended by striking the terms "wine or beer"
 40 28 after the term "alcoholic beverage" as the term "alcoholic
 40 29 beverage" includes wine and beer.
 40 30    Code section 123.50A, concerning the alcohol compliance
 40 31 employee training program, is amended by striking the phrase
 40 32 "and federal liquor" in describing the subject matter of the
 40 33 state training program and by substituting the term "alcoholic
 40 34 beverages" for the terms "alcoholic liquor, wine, or beer".
 40 35    Code section 123.56, concerning native wines, is amended by
 41  1 striking the phrase "the class "A" wine permit" and inserting
 41  2 a reference to Code section 123.173 that addresses how native
 41  3 wine is sold to retailers.
 41  4    Code sections 123.81 and 123.84 are amended by adding the
 41  5 word "alcoholic" before the word "liquor".
 41  6    Code section 123.91 is amended by substituting the term
 41  7 "alcoholic liquors" for "intoxicating liquors".
 41  8    Code section 123.92, concerning dramshop liability, is
 41  9 amended by substituting "alcoholic beverage" for "beer, wine,
 41 10 or intoxicating liquors" within the section.
 41 11    Code section 123.98, concerning labeling shipments, is
 41 12 amended by adding the terms "wine or beer" and by substituting
 41 13 the term "alcoholic liquors" for "intoxicating liquors".
 41 14    Code sections 123.99, 123.100, 123.101, 123.103, 123.104,
 41 15 123.106, 123.107, 123.111, 123.115, 123.116, 123.119, 123.120,
 41 16 and 123.121 are amended by substituting the term "alcoholic
 41 17 liquor" for "intoxicating liquor" and "liquor".
 41 18    Code section 123.127, concerning class "A" and special class
 41 19 "A" beer permit application and issuance, is amended to provide
 41 20 that an applicant file a basic permit issued to the applicant
 41 21 by the alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United
 41 22 States department of the treasury.
 41 23    Code section 123.130, concerning authority under a class "A"
 41 24 and special class "A" beer permit, is amended to provide that
 41 25 a holder of a special class "A" beer permit may operate as a
 41 26 brewpub and that the authority of the permit is limited.
 41 27    Code section 123.131, concerning authority under a class "B"
 41 28 beer permit, is amended to specify how a class "B" beer permit
 41 29 holder may operate as a brewpub.
 41 30    Code section 123.139, concerning beer permits for separate
 41 31 locations, is amended to provide that each place of business
 41 32 where beer is manufactured requires a separate permit.
 41 33    Code section 123.173, concerning wine permits, is amended by
 41 34 adding class "D" liquor  control  licensee to the list of retail
 41 35 licensees that may purchase wine from a class "A" wine permit
 42  1 holder.
 42  2    Code section 123.175, concerning certain wine permit
 42  3 applications and issuance, is amended to provide that an
 42  4 applicant file a basic permit issued to the applicant by the
 42  5 alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United States
 42  6 department of the treasury.
 42  7    Code section 123.177, concerning class "A" wine permits, is
 42  8 amended to provide that each place of business where wine is
 42  9 manufactured requires a separate permit.
 42 10    Code section 123.181, concerning prohibited acts, is amended
 42 11 by providing that a class "A" wine permittee is prohibited from
 42 12 selling wine on credit to any retail licensee or permittee.
 42 13    Code section 123.186, concerning federal regulation adopted
 42 14 as rules, is amended to provide that a licensee or permittee
 42 15 who violates a rule adopted pursuant to the Code section is
 42 16 guilty of a violation of the Code section and subject to
 42 17 the general penalties provided in Code chapter 123 and the
 42 18 suspension, revocation, and civil penalty provisions of Code
 42 19 section 123.39.
 42 20    Code section 123.187, concerning direct shipment of wine, is
 42 21 amended.   The bill changes the wine direct shipper license to
 42 22 a permit and replaces the alcohol carrier license with a wine
 42 23 carrier permit.  The bill specifically provides that only a
 42 24 wine manufacturer that holds a wine direct shipper permit shall
 42 25 sell wine at retail for direct shipment to any person within
 42 26 this state and requires that an applicant for a wine direct
 42 27 shipper permit file the manufacturer's basic permit issued by
 42 28 the alcohol and tobacco, tax and trade bureau of the United
 42 29 States department of the treasury.  The bill also provides that
 42 30 a violation of this Code section shall subject the permittee
 42 31 to the general penalties provided in Code chapter 123 and the
 42 32 suspension, revocation, and civil penalty provisions of Code
 42 33 section 123.39.

 37 30 The bill adds a definition for "brewpub" which means a
 37 31 commercial establishment authorized to sell beer at retail
 37 32 for consumption on or off the premises that is operated by
 37 33 a retail class "C" liquor control licensee or class "B" beer
 37 34 permittee who also holds a special class "A" beer permit to
 37 35 manufacture and sell beer.  The bill also amends the definition
 38  1 of "broker" to provide that it also applies to a person who
 38  2 represents or promotes alcoholic liquor on behalf of a holder
 38  3 of a manufacturer's license or a class "A" native distilled
 38  4 spirits license.  The bill amends the definition of "alcoholic
 38  5 liquor" by striking the alternative term "intoxicating liquor".
 38  6 The bill further replaces the term "alcoholic liquor" for
 38  7 "intoxicating liquor" wherever the term appears in Code chapter
 38  8 123.
 38  9    Code section 123.4 is amended by substituting the defined
 38 10 term "alcoholic beverage" for the terms "beer, wine, and
 38 11 alcoholic liquor".  The term "alcoholic beverage" is defined to
 38 12 include beer, wine, and alcoholic liquor.
 38 13    Code section 123.9 is amended by striking the term "special
 38 14 permits" and by substituting the defined term "alcoholic
 38 15 beverage" for the terms "beer, wine, and alcoholic liquor".
 38 16    Code section 123.10 is amended by substituting the defined
 38 17 term "alcoholic beverage" for the terms "intoxicating liquor or
 38 18 beer".
 38 19    Code section 123.14 is amended by substituting the phrase
 38 20 "alcoholic beverage control" for the terms "intoxicating liquor
 38 21 or beer".
 38 22    Code section 123.23, concerning a distiller's certificate of
 38 23 compliance, is amended by substituting "alcoholic liquors" for
 38 24 "alcoholic beverages" as the section is limited to alcoholic
 38 25 liquor and is not applicable to wine or beer.
 38 26    Code section 123.25 is amended to provide that the
 38 27 consumption of any alcoholic beverages on the premises of the
 38 28 state=owned warehouse is prohibited, with the exception of
 38 29 alcoholic liquor that is consumed for sampling purposes.
 38 30    Code section 123.28, concerning the delivery of liquor
 38 31 purchased from class "E" liquor control license holders by
 38 32 certain liquor control licensees is amended to include class
 38 33 "C" native distilled spirits and class "D" liquor control
 38 34 licensees.  The section is also amended by striking a reference
 38 35 to special permits.
 39  1 Code section 123.30, concerning classes of liquor control
 39  2 licenses, is amended.  The bill authorizes a class "C" liquor
 39  3 control licensee to also hold a special class "A" beer permit
 39  4 for the purpose of operating a brewpub.  The bill also amends
 39  5 provisions relative to a class "E" liquor control license by
 39  6 providing that class "E" liquor control license holders are
 39  7 authorized to sell at retail to the public and to sell at
 39  8 wholesale to other retailers, provided they have been issued a
 39  9 basic permit by the alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of
 39 10 the United States department of the treasury.
 39 11    Code section 123.32, concerning action by local authorities
 39 12 and the division on applications for liquor control licenses,
 39 13 native distilled spirits licenses, and wine, and beer permits,
 39 14 is amended by striking three Code citations that reference the
 39 15 authority granted by various wine permits and replacing the
 39 16 reference with a Code reference that describes the application
 39 17 process for obtaining the permits.
 39 18    Code section 123.33, concerning records, is amended to
 39 19 allow licensees and permittees to keep records in printed or
 39 20 electronic format and not both.
 39 21    Code section 123.34, concerning the expiration of certain
 39 22 shorter term licenses and permits, is amended to allow the
 39 23 administrator to provide notice of expiration to licensees and
 39 24 permit holders electronically in lieu of written notice.
 39 25    Code section 123.36, concerning Sunday sales, is amended to
 39 26 provide that certain liquor control licensees are authorized
 39 27 to sell alcoholic beverages on Sunday as authorized by Code
 39 28 section 123.30.
 39 29    Code section 123.37 is amended by striking the terms "wine
 39 30 or beer" after the term "alcoholic beverages" as the term
 39 31 "alcoholic beverages" includes wine and beer.
 39 32    Code section 123.38 is amended by striking the term "special
 39 33 permits".
 39 34    Code section 123.39, concerning revocation or suspension of
 39 35 licenses or permits, is amended to refer to all liquor control
 40  1 licenses as the types of businesses that are required to report
 40  2 ownership changes to the local authority and the alcoholic
 40  3 beverages division and further provides that licensees
 40  4 shall report ownership changes in a manner prescribed by the
 40  5 administrator of the alcoholic beverages division within 30
 40  6 days of the change.
 40  7    Code section 123.41, concerning manufacturer's license for
 40  8 alcoholic liquor, is amended to provide that an applicant for
 40  9 a license file a basic permit issued to the applicant by the

 40 11 department of the treasury in lieu of a statement that proves
 40 12 status as a "bona fide manufacturer of alcohol liquors".

 39 20 electronic format and not both.
 39 21    Code section 123.34, concerning the expiration of certain
 39 22 shorter term licenses and permits, is amended to allow the
 39 23 administrator to provide notice of expiration to licensees and
 39 24 permit holders electronically in lieu of written notice.
 39 25    Code section 123.36, concerning Sunday sales, is amended to
 39 26 provide that certain liquor control licensees are authorized
 39 27 to sell alcoholic beverages on Sunday as authorized by Code
 39 28 section 123.30.
 39 29    Code section 123.37 is amended by striking the terms "wine
 39 30 or beer" after the term "alcoholic beverages" as the term
 39 31 "alcoholic beverages" includes wine and beer.
 39 32    Code section 123.38 is amended by striking the term "special
 39 33 permits".
 39 34    Code section 123.39, concerning revocation or suspension of
 39 35 licenses or permits, is amended to refer to all liquor control
 40  1 licenses as the types of businesses that are required to report
 40  2 ownership changes to the local authority and the alcoholic
 40  3 beverages division and further provides that licensees
 40  4 shall report ownership changes in a manner prescribed by the
 40  5 administrator of the alcoholic beverages division within 30
 40  6 days of the change.
 40  7    Code section 123.41, concerning manufacturer's license for
 40  8 alcoholic liquor, is amended to provide that an applicant for
 40  9 a license file a basic permit issued to the applicant by the
 40 10 alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United States
 40 11 department of the treasury in lieu of a statement that proves
 40 12 status as a "bona fide manufacturer of alcohol liquors".
 40 13    Code section 123.42, concerning a broker's permit, is
 40 14 amended to provide that the broker list on the application
 40 15 for a permit shall list all manufacturers, distillers, and
 40 16 importers the applicant will represent and is further required
 40 17 to keep the list updated.
 40 18    Code section 123.44, prohibiting certain gifts of liquor, is
 40 19 amended by adding distiller and brewer to the list of persons
 40 20 who are prohibited from providing gifts of alcoholic beverages
 40 21 to the alcoholic beverages commission and employees of the
 40 22 alcoholic beverages division.
 40 23    Code sections 123.47 and 123.49 are amended by substituting
 40 24 the defined term "alcoholic beverage" or "alcoholic beverages"
 40 25 for the terms "beer, wine, and alcoholic liquor".
 40 26    Code section 123.50, concerning criminal and civil
 40 27 penalties, is amended by striking the terms "wine or beer"
 40 28 after the term "alcoholic beverage" as the term "alcoholic
 40 29 beverage" includes wine and beer.
 40 30    Code section 123.50A, concerning the alcohol compliance
 40 31 employee training program, is amended by striking the phrase
 40 32 "and federal liquor" in describing the subject matter of the
 40 33 state training program and by substituting the term "alcoholic
 40 34 beverages" for the terms "alcoholic liquor, wine, or beer".
 40 35    Code section 123.56, concerning native wines, is amended by
 41  1 striking the phrase "the class "A" wine permit" and inserting
 41  2 a reference to Code section 123.173 that addresses how native
 41  3 wine is sold to retailers.
 41  4    Code sections 123.81 and 123.84 are amended by adding the
 41  5 word "alcoholic" before the word "liquor".
 41  6    Code section 123.91 is amended by substituting the term
 41  7 "alcoholic liquors" for "intoxicating liquors".
 41  8    Code section 123.92, concerning dramshop liability, is
 41  9 amended by substituting "alcoholic beverage" for "beer, wine,
 41 10 or intoxicating liquors" within the section.
 41 11    Code section 123.98, concerning labeling shipments, is
 41 12 amended by adding the terms "wine or beer" and by substituting
 41 13 the term "alcoholic liquors" for "intoxicating liquors".
 41 14    Code sections 123.99, 123.100, 123.101, 123.103, 123.104,
 41 15 123.106, 123.107, 123.111, 123.115, 123.116, 123.119, 123.120,
 41 16 and 123.121 are amended by substituting the term "alcoholic
 41 17 liquor" for "intoxicating liquor" and "liquor".
 41 18    Code section 123.127, concerning class "A" and special class
 41 19 "A" beer permit application and issuance, is amended to provide
 41 20 that an applicant file a basic permit issued to the applicant
 41 21 by the alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United
 41 22 States department of the treasury.
 41 23    Code section 123.130, concerning authority under a class "A"
 41 24 and special class "A" beer permit, is amended to provide that
 41 25 a holder of a special class "A" beer permit may operate as a
 41 26 brewpub and that the authority of the permit is limited.
 41 27    Code section 123.131, concerning authority under a class "B"
 41 28 beer permit, is amended to specify how a class "B" beer permit
 41 29 holder may operate as a brewpub.
 41 30    Code section 123.139, concerning beer permits for separate
 41 31 locations, is amended to provide that each place of business
 41 32 where beer is manufactured requires a separate permit.
 41 33    Code section 123.173, concerning wine permits, is amended by
 41 34 adding class "D" liquor  control  licensee to the list of retail
 41 35 licensees that may purchase wine from a class "A" wine permit
 42  1 holder.
 42  2    Code section 123.175, concerning certain wine permit
 42  3 applications and issuance, is amended to provide that an
 42  4 applicant file a basic permit issued to the applicant by the
 42  5 alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United States
 42  6 department of the treasury.
 42  7    Code section 123.177, concerning class "A" wine permits, is
 42  8 amended to provide that each place of business where wine is
 42  9 manufactured requires a separate permit.
 42 10    Code section 123.181, concerning prohibited acts, is amended
 42 11 by providing that a class "A" wine permittee is prohibited from
 42 12 selling wine on credit to any retail licensee or permittee.
 42 13    Code section 123.186, concerning federal regulation adopted
 42 14 as rules, is amended to provide that a licensee or permittee
 42 15 who violates a rule adopted pursuant to the Code section is
 42 16 guilty of a violation of the Code section and subject to
 42 17 the general penalties provided in Code chapter 123 and the
 42 18 suspension, revocation, and civil penalty provisions of Code
 42 19 section 123.39.
 42 20    Code section 123.187, concerning direct shipment of wine, is
 42 21 amended.   The bill changes the wine direct shipper license to
 42 22 a permit and replaces the alcohol carrier license with a wine
 42 23 carrier permit.  The bill specifically provides that only a
 42 24 wine manufacturer that holds a wine direct shipper permit shall
 42 25 sell wine at retail for direct shipment to any person within
 42 26 this state and requires that an applicant for a wine direct
 42 27 shipper permit file the manufacturer's basic permit issued by
 42 28 the alcohol and tobacco, tax and trade bureau of the United
 42 29 States department of the treasury.  The bill also provides that
 42 30 a violation of this Code section shall subject the permittee
 42 31 to the general penalties provided in Code chapter 123 and the
 42 32 suspension, revocation, and civil penalty provisions of Code
 42 33 section 123.39.

 37 33 a retail class "C" liquor control licensee or class "B" beer
 37 34 permittee who also holds a special class "A" beer permit to
 37 35 manufacture and sell beer.  The bill also amends the definition
 38  1 of "broker" to provide that it also applies to a person who
 38  2 represents or promotes alcoholic liquor on behalf of a holder
 38  3 of a manufacturer's license or a class "A" native distilled
 38  4 spirits license.  The bill amends the definition of "alcoholic
 38  5 liquor" by striking the alternative term "intoxicating liquor".

 38  7 "intoxicating liquor" wherever the term appears in Code chapter
 38  8 123.

 38 25 liquor and is not applicable to wine or beer.
 38 26    Code section 123.25 is amended to provide that the
 38 27 consumption of any alcoholic beverages on the premises of the
 38 28 state=owned warehouse is prohibited, with the exception of
 38 29 alcoholic liquor that is consumed for sampling purposes.

 38 31 purchased from class "E" liquor control license holders by

 38 34 licensees.  The section is also amended by striking a reference

 39  4 for the purpose of operating a brewpub.  The bill also amends
 39  5 provisions relative to a class "E" liquor control license by

 39  4 for the purpose of operating a brewpub.  The bill also amends
 39  5 provisions relative to a class "E" liquor control license by
 39  6 providing that class "E" liquor control license holders are
 39  7 authorized to sell at retail to the public and to sell at
 39  8 wholesale to other retailers, provided they have been issued a
 39  9 basic permit by the alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of
 39 10 the United States department of the treasury.
 39 11    Code section 123.32, concerning action by local authorities
 39 12 and the division on applications for liquor control licenses,
 39 13 native distilled spirits licenses, and wine, and beer permits,
 39 14 is amended by striking three Code citations that reference the
 39 15 authority granted by various wine permits and replacing the
 39 16 reference with a Code reference that describes the application
 39 17 process for obtaining the permits.
 39 18    Code section 123.33, concerning records, is amended to
 39 19 allow licensees and permittees to keep records in printed or
 39 20 electronic format and not both.
 39 21    Code section 123.34, concerning the expiration of certain
 39 22 shorter term licenses and permits, is amended to allow the
 39 23 administrator to provide notice of expiration to licensees and
 39 24 permit holders electronically in lieu of written notice.
 39 25    Code section 123.36, concerning Sunday sales, is amended to
 39 26 provide that certain liquor control licensees are authorized
 39 27 to sell alcoholic beverages on Sunday as authorized by Code
 39 28 section 123.30.
 39 29    Code section 123.37 is amended by striking the terms "wine
 39 30 or beer" after the term "alcoholic beverages" as the term
 39 31 "alcoholic beverages" includes wine and beer.
 39 32    Code section 123.38 is amended by striking the term "special
 39 33 permits".
 39 34    Code section 123.39, concerning revocation or suspension of
 39 35 licenses or permits, is amended to refer to all liquor control
 40  1 licenses as the types of businesses that are required to report
 40  2 ownership changes to the local authority and the alcoholic
 40  3 beverages division and further provides that licensees
 40  4 shall report ownership changes in a manner prescribed by the
 40  5 administrator of the alcoholic beverages division within 30
 40  6 days of the change.
 40  7    Code section 123.41, concerning manufacturer's license for
 40  8 alcoholic liquor, is amended to provide that an applicant for
 40  9 a license file a basic permit issued to the applicant by the
 40 10 alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United States
 40 11 department of the treasury in lieu of a statement that proves
 40 12 status as a "bona fide manufacturer of alcohol liquors".
 40 13    Code section 123.42, concerning a broker's permit, is
 40 14 amended to provide that the broker list on the application
 40 15 for a permit shall list all manufacturers, distillers, and
 40 16 importers the applicant will represent and is further required
 40 17 to keep the list updated.
 40 18    Code section 123.44, prohibiting certain gifts of liquor, is
 40 19 amended by adding distiller and brewer to the list of persons
 40 20 who are prohibited from providing gifts of alcoholic beverages
 40 21 to the alcoholic beverages commission and employees of the
 40 22 alcoholic beverages division.
 40 23    Code sections 123.47 and 123.49 are amended by substituting
 40 24 the defined term "alcoholic beverage" or "alcoholic beverages"
 40 25 for the terms "beer, wine, and alcoholic liquor".
 40 26    Code section 123.50, concerning criminal and civil
 40 27 penalties, is amended by striking the terms "wine or beer"
 40 28 after the term "alcoholic beverage" as the term "alcoholic
 40 29 beverage" includes wine and beer.
 40 30    Code section 123.50A, concerning the alcohol compliance
 40 31 employee training program, is amended by striking the phrase
 40 32 "and federal liquor" in describing the subject matter of the
 40 33 state training program and by substituting the term "alcoholic
 40 34 beverages" for the terms "alcoholic liquor, wine, or beer".
 40 35    Code section 123.56, concerning native wines, is amended by
 41  1 striking the phrase "the class "A" wine permit" and inserting
 41  2 a reference to Code section 123.173 that addresses how native
 41  3 wine is sold to retailers.
 41  4    Code sections 123.81 and 123.84 are amended by adding the
 41  5 word "alcoholic" before the word "liquor".
 41  6    Code section 123.91 is amended by substituting the term
 41  7 "alcoholic liquors" for "intoxicating liquors".
 41  8    Code section 123.92, concerning dramshop liability, is
 41  9 amended by substituting "alcoholic beverage" for "beer, wine,
 41 10 or intoxicating liquors" within the section.
 41 11    Code section 123.98, concerning labeling shipments, is
 41 12 amended by adding the terms "wine or beer" and by substituting
 41 13 the term "alcoholic liquors" for "intoxicating liquors".
 41 14    Code sections 123.99, 123.100, 123.101, 123.103, 123.104,
 41 15 123.106, 123.107, 123.111, 123.115, 123.116, 123.119, 123.120,
 41 16 and 123.121 are amended by substituting the term "alcoholic
 41 17 liquor" for "intoxicating liquor" and "liquor".
 41 18    Code section 123.127, concerning class "A" and special class
 41 19 "A" beer permit application and issuance, is amended to provide
 41 20 that an applicant file a basic permit issued to the applicant
 41 21 by the alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United
 41 22 States department of the treasury.
 41 23    Code section 123.130, concerning authority under a class "A"
 41 24 and special class "A" beer permit, is amended to provide that
 41 25 a holder of a special class "A" beer permit may operate as a
 41 26 brewpub and that the authority of the permit is limited.
 41 27    Code section 123.131, concerning authority under a class "B"
 41 28 beer permit, is amended to specify how a class "B" beer permit
 41 29 holder may operate as a brewpub.
 41 30    Code section 123.139, concerning beer permits for separate
 41 31 locations, is amended to provide that each place of business
 41 32 where beer is manufactured requires a separate permit.
 41 33    Code section 123.173, concerning wine permits, is amended by
 41 34 adding class "D" liquor  control  licensee to the list of retail
 41 35 licensees that may purchase wine from a class "A" wine permit
 42  1 holder.
 42  2    Code section 123.175, concerning certain wine permit
 42  3 applications and issuance, is amended to provide that an
 42  4 applicant file a basic permit issued to the applicant by the
 42  5 alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United States
 42  6 department of the treasury.
 42  7    Code section 123.177, concerning class "A" wine permits, is
 42  8 amended to provide that each place of business where wine is
 42  9 manufactured requires a separate permit.
 42 10    Code section 123.181, concerning prohibited acts, is amended
 42 11 by providing that a class "A" wine permittee is prohibited from
 42 12 selling wine on credit to any retail licensee or permittee.
 42 13    Code section 123.186, concerning federal regulation adopted
 42 14 as rules, is amended to provide that a licensee or permittee
 42 15 who violates a rule adopted pursuant to the Code section is
 42 16 guilty of a violation of the Code section and subject to
 42 17 the general penalties provided in Code chapter 123 and the
 42 18 suspension, revocation, and civil penalty provisions of Code
 42 19 section 123.39.
 42 20    Code section 123.187, concerning direct shipment of wine, is
 42 21 amended.   The bill changes the wine direct shipper license to
 42 22 a permit and replaces the alcohol carrier license with a wine
 42 23 carrier permit.  The bill specifically provides that only a
 42 24 wine manufacturer that holds a wine direct shipper permit shall
 42 25 sell wine at retail for direct shipment to any person within
 42 26 this state and requires that an applicant for a wine direct
 42 27 shipper permit file the manufacturer's basic permit issued by
 42 28 the alcohol and tobacco, tax and trade bureau of the United
 42 29 States department of the treasury.  The bill also provides that
 42 30 a violation of this Code section shall subject the permittee
 42 31 to the general penalties provided in Code chapter 123 and the
 42 32 suspension, revocation, and civil penalty provisions of Code
 42 33 section 123.39.

 38 34 licensees.  The section is also amended by striking a reference
 38 35 to special permits.
 39  1 Code section 123.30, concerning classes of liquor control
 39  2 licenses, is amended.  The bill authorizes a class "C" liquor
 39  3 control licensee to also hold a special class "A" beer permit
 39  4 for the purpose of operating a brewpub.  The bill also amends
 39  5 provisions relative to a class "E" liquor control license by
 39  6 providing that class "E" liquor control license holders are
 39  7 authorized to sell at retail to the public and to sell at
 39  8 wholesale to other retailers, provided they have been issued a
 39  9 basic permit by the alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of
 39 10 the United States department of the treasury.
 39 11    Code section 123.32, concerning action by local authorities
 39 12 and the division on applications for liquor control licenses,
 39 13 native distilled spirits licenses, and wine, and beer permits,
 39 14 is amended by striking three Code citations that reference the
 39 15 authority granted by various wine permits and replacing the
 39 16 reference with a Code reference that describes the application
 39 17 process for obtaining the permits.
 39 18    Code section 123.33, concerning records, is amended to
 39 19 allow licensees and permittees to keep records in printed or
 39 20 electronic format and not both.
 39 21    Code section 123.34, concerning the expiration of certain
 39 22 shorter term licenses and permits, is amended to allow the
 39 23 administrator to provide notice of expiration to licensees and
 39 24 permit holders electronically in lieu of written notice.
 39 25    Code section 123.36, concerning Sunday sales, is amended to
 39 26 provide that certain liquor control licensees are authorized
 39 27 to sell alcoholic beverages on Sunday as authorized by Code
 39 28 section 123.30.
 39 29    Code section 123.37 is amended by striking the terms "wine
 39 30 or beer" after the term "alcoholic beverages" as the term
 39 31 "alcoholic beverages" includes wine and beer.
 39 32    Code section 123.38 is amended by striking the term "special
 39 33 permits".
 39 34    Code section 123.39, concerning revocation or suspension of
 39 35 licenses or permits, is amended to refer to all liquor control
 40  1 licenses as the types of businesses that are required to report
 40  2 ownership changes to the local authority and the alcoholic
 40  3 beverages division and further provides that licensees
 40  4 shall report ownership changes in a manner prescribed by the
 40  5 administrator of the alcoholic beverages division within 30
 40  6 days of the change.
 40  7    Code section 123.41, concerning manufacturer's license for
 40  8 alcoholic liquor, is amended to provide that an applicant for
 40  9 a license file a basic permit issued to the applicant by the
 40 10 alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United States
 40 11 department of the treasury in lieu of a statement that proves
 40 12 status as a "bona fide manufacturer of alcohol liquors".
 40 13    Code section 123.42, concerning a broker's permit, is
 40 14 amended to provide that the broker list on the application
 40 15 for a permit shall list all manufacturers, distillers, and
 40 16 importers the applicant will represent and is further required
 40 17 to keep the list updated.
 40 18    Code section 123.44, prohibiting certain gifts of liquor, is
 40 19 amended by adding distiller and brewer to the list of persons
 40 20 who are prohibited from providing gifts of alcoholic beverages
 40 21 to the alcoholic beverages commission and employees of the
 40 22 alcoholic beverages division.
 40 23    Code sections 123.47 and 123.49 are amended by substituting
 40 24 the defined term "alcoholic beverage" or "alcoholic beverages"
 40 25 for the terms "beer, wine, and alcoholic liquor".
 40 26    Code section 123.50, concerning criminal and civil
 40 27 penalties, is amended by striking the terms "wine or beer"
 40 28 after the term "alcoholic beverage" as the term "alcoholic
 40 29 beverage" includes wine and beer.
 40 30    Code section 123.50A, concerning the alcohol compliance
 40 31 employee training program, is amended by striking the phrase
 40 32 "and federal liquor" in describing the subject matter of the
 40 33 state training program and by substituting the term "alcoholic
 40 34 beverages" for the terms "alcoholic liquor, wine, or beer".
 40 35    Code section 123.56, concerning native wines, is amended by
 41  1 striking the phrase "the class "A" wine permit" and inserting
 41  2 a reference to Code section 123.173 that addresses how native
 41  3 wine is sold to retailers.
 41  4    Code sections 123.81 and 123.84 are amended by adding the
 41  5 word "alcoholic" before the word "liquor".
 41  6    Code section 123.91 is amended by substituting the term
 41  7 "alcoholic liquors" for "intoxicating liquors".
 41  8    Code section 123.92, concerning dramshop liability, is
 41  9 amended by substituting "alcoholic beverage" for "beer, wine,
 41 10 or intoxicating liquors" within the section.
 41 11    Code section 123.98, concerning labeling shipments, is
 41 12 amended by adding the terms "wine or beer" and by substituting
 41 13 the term "alcoholic liquors" for "intoxicating liquors".
 41 14    Code sections 123.99, 123.100, 123.101, 123.103, 123.104,
 41 15 123.106, 123.107, 123.111, 123.115, 123.116, 123.119, 123.120,
 41 16 and 123.121 are amended by substituting the term "alcoholic
 41 17 liquor" for "intoxicating liquor" and "liquor".
 41 18    Code section 123.127, concerning class "A" and special class
 41 19 "A" beer permit application and issuance, is amended to provide
 41 20 that an applicant file a basic permit issued to the applicant
 41 21 by the alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United
 41 22 States department of the treasury.
 41 23    Code section 123.130, concerning authority under a class "A"
 41 24 and special class "A" beer permit, is amended to provide that
 41 25 a holder of a special class "A" beer permit may operate as a
 41 26 brewpub and that the authority of the permit is limited.
 41 27    Code section 123.131, concerning authority under a class "B"
 41 28 beer permit, is amended to specify how a class "B" beer permit
 41 29 holder may operate as a brewpub.
 41 30    Code section 123.139, concerning beer permits for separate
 41 31 locations, is amended to provide that each place of business
 41 32 where beer is manufactured requires a separate permit.
 41 33    Code section 123.173, concerning wine permits, is amended by
 41 34 adding class "D" liquor  control  licensee to the list of retail
 41 35 licensees that may purchase wine from a class "A" wine permit
 42  1 holder.
 42  2    Code section 123.175, concerning certain wine permit
 42  3 applications and issuance, is amended to provide that an
 42  4 applicant file a basic permit issued to the applicant by the
 42  5 alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United States
 42  6 department of the treasury.
 42  7    Code section 123.177, concerning class "A" wine permits, is
 42  8 amended to provide that each place of business where wine is
 42  9 manufactured requires a separate permit.
 42 10    Code section 123.181, concerning prohibited acts, is amended
 42 11 by providing that a class "A" wine permittee is prohibited from
 42 12 selling wine on credit to any retail licensee or permittee.
 42 13    Code section 123.186, concerning federal regulation adopted
 42 14 as rules, is amended to provide that a licensee or permittee
 42 15 who violates a rule adopted pursuant to the Code section is
 42 16 guilty of a violation of the Code section and subject to
 42 17 the general penalties provided in Code chapter 123 and the
 42 18 suspension, revocation, and civil penalty provisions of Code
 42 19 section 123.39.
 42 20    Code section 123.187, concerning direct shipment of wine, is
 42 21 amended.   The bill changes the wine direct shipper license to
 42 22 a permit and replaces the alcohol carrier license with a wine
 42 23 carrier permit.  The bill specifically provides that only a
 42 24 wine manufacturer that holds a wine direct shipper permit shall
 42 25 sell wine at retail for direct shipment to any person within
 42 26 this state and requires that an applicant for a wine direct
 42 27 shipper permit file the manufacturer's basic permit issued by
 42 28 the alcohol and tobacco, tax and trade bureau of the United
 42 29 States department of the treasury.  The bill also provides that
 42 30 a violation of this Code section shall subject the permittee
 42 31 to the general penalties provided in Code chapter 123 and the
 42 32 suspension, revocation, and civil penalty provisions of Code
 42 33 section 123.39.

 39  4 for the purpose of operating a brewpub.  The bill also amends
 39  5 provisions relative to a class "E" liquor control license by
 39  6 providing that class "E" liquor control license holders are
 39  7 authorized to sell at retail to the public and to sell at
 39  8 wholesale to other retailers, provided they have been issued a
 39  9 basic permit by the alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of
 39 10 the United States department of the treasury.
 39 11    Code section 123.32, concerning action by local authorities
 39 12 and the division on applications for liquor control licenses,
 39 13 native distilled spirits licenses, and wine, and beer permits,
 39 14 is amended by striking three Code citations that reference the
 39 15 authority granted by various wine permits and replacing the
 39 16 reference with a Code reference that describes the application
 39 17 process for obtaining the permits.
 39 18    Code section 123.33, concerning records, is amended to
 39 19 allow licensees and permittees to keep records in printed or
 39 20 electronic format and not both.
 39 21    Code section 123.34, concerning the expiration of certain
 39 22 shorter term licenses and permits, is amended to allow the
 39 23 administrator to provide notice of expiration to licensees and
 39 24 permit holders electronically in lieu of written notice.
 39 25    Code section 123.36, concerning Sunday sales, is amended to
 39 26 provide that certain liquor control licensees are authorized
 39 27 to sell alcoholic beverages on Sunday as authorized by Code
 39 28 section 123.30.
 39 29    Code section 123.37 is amended by striking the terms "wine
 39 30 or beer" after the term "alcoholic beverages" as the term
 39 31 "alcoholic beverages" includes wine and beer.
 39 32    Code section 123.38 is amended by striking the term "special
 39 33 permits".
 39 34    Code section 123.39, concerning revocation or suspension of
 39 35 licenses or permits, is amended to refer to all liquor control
 40  1 licenses as the types of businesses that are required to report
 40  2 ownership changes to the local authority and the alcoholic
 40  3 beverages division and further provides that licensees
 40  4 shall report ownership changes in a manner prescribed by the
 40  5 administrator of the alcoholic beverages division within 30
 40  6 days of the change.
 40  7    Code section 123.41, concerning manufacturer's license for
 40  8 alcoholic liquor, is amended to provide that an applicant for
 40  9 a license file a basic permit issued to the applicant by the
 40 10 alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United States
 40 11 department of the treasury in lieu of a statement that proves
 40 12 status as a "bona fide manufacturer of alcohol liquors".
 40 13    Code section 123.42, concerning a broker's permit, is
 40 14 amended to provide that the broker list on the application
 40 15 for a permit shall list all manufacturers, distillers, and
 40 16 importers the applicant will represent and is further required
 40 17 to keep the list updated.
 40 18    Code section 123.44, prohibiting certain gifts of liquor, is
 40 19 amended by adding distiller and brewer to the list of persons
 40 20 who are prohibited from providing gifts of alcoholic beverages
 40 21 to the alcoholic beverages commission and employees of the
 40 22 alcoholic beverages division.
 40 23    Code sections 123.47 and 123.49 are amended by substituting
 40 24 the defined term "alcoholic beverage" or "alcoholic beverages"
 40 25 for the terms "beer, wine, and alcoholic liquor".
 40 26    Code section 123.50, concerning criminal and civil
 40 27 penalties, is amended by striking the terms "wine or beer"
 40 28 after the term "alcoholic beverage" as the term "alcoholic
 40 29 beverage" includes wine and beer.
 40 30    Code section 123.50A, concerning the alcohol compliance
 40 31 employee training program, is amended by striking the phrase
 40 32 "and federal liquor" in describing the subject matter of the
 40 33 state training program and by substituting the term "alcoholic
 40 34 beverages" for the terms "alcoholic liquor, wine, or beer".
 40 35    Code section 123.56, concerning native wines, is amended by
 41  1 striking the phrase "the class "A" wine permit" and inserting
 41  2 a reference to Code section 123.173 that addresses how native
 41  3 wine is sold to retailers.
 41  4    Code sections 123.81 and 123.84 are amended by adding the
 41  5 word "alcoholic" before the word "liquor".
 41  6    Code section 123.91 is amended by substituting the term
 41  7 "alcoholic liquors" for "intoxicating liquors".
 41  8    Code section 123.92, concerning dramshop liability, is
 41  9 amended by substituting "alcoholic beverage" for "beer, wine,
 41 10 or intoxicating liquors" within the section.
 41 11    Code section 123.98, concerning labeling shipments, is
 41 12 amended by adding the terms "wine or beer" and by substituting
 41 13 the term "alcoholic liquors" for "intoxicating liquors".
 41 14    Code sections 123.99, 123.100, 123.101, 123.103, 123.104,
 41 15 123.106, 123.107, 123.111, 123.115, 123.116, 123.119, 123.120,
 41 16 and 123.121 are amended by substituting the term "alcoholic
 41 17 liquor" for "intoxicating liquor" and "liquor".
 41 18    Code section 123.127, concerning class "A" and special class
 41 19 "A" beer permit application and issuance, is amended to provide
 41 20 that an applicant file a basic permit issued to the applicant
 41 21 by the alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United
 41 22 States department of the treasury.
 41 23    Code section 123.130, concerning authority under a class "A"
 41 24 and special class "A" beer permit, is amended to provide that
 41 25 a holder of a special class "A" beer permit may operate as a
 41 26 brewpub and that the authority of the permit is limited.
 41 27    Code section 123.131, concerning authority under a class "B"
 41 28 beer permit, is amended to specify how a class "B" beer permit
 41 29 holder may operate as a brewpub.
 41 30    Code section 123.139, concerning beer permits for separate
 41 31 locations, is amended to provide that each place of business
 41 32 where beer is manufactured requires a separate permit.
 41 33    Code section 123.173, concerning wine permits, is amended by
 41 34 adding class "D" liquor  control  licensee to the list of retail
 41 35 licensees that may purchase wine from a class "A" wine permit
 42  1 holder.
 42  2    Code section 123.175, concerning certain wine permit
 42  3 applications and issuance, is amended to provide that an
 42  4 applicant file a basic permit issued to the applicant by the
 42  5 alcohol and tobacco tax and trade bureau of the United States
 42  6 department of the treasury.
 42  7    Code section 123.177, concerning class "A" wine permits, is
 42  8 amended to provide that each place of business where wine is
 42  9 manufactured requires a separate permit.
 42 10    Code section 123.181, concerning prohibited acts, is amended
 42 11 by providing that a class "A" wine permittee is prohibited from
 42 12 selling wine on credit to any retail licensee or permittee.
 42 13    Code section 123.186, concerning federal regulation adopted
 42 14 as rules, is amended to provide that a licensee or permittee
 42 15 who violates a rule adopted pursuant to the Code section is
 42 16 guilty of a violation of the Code section and subject to
 42 17 the general penalties provided in Code chapter 123 and the
 42 18 suspension, revocation, and civil penalty provisions of Code
 42 19 section 123.39.
 42 20    Code section 123.187, concerning direct shipment of wine, is
 42 21 amended.   The bill changes the wine direct shipper license to
 42 22 a permit and replaces the alcohol carrier license with a wine
 42 23 carrier permit.  The bill specifically provides that only a
 42 24 wine manufacturer that holds a wine direct shipper permit shall
 42 25 sell wine at retail for direct shipment to any person within
 42 26 this state and requires that an applicant for a wine direct
 42 27 shipper permit file the manufacturer's basic permit issued by
 42 28 the alcohol and tobacco, tax and trade bureau of the United
 42 29 States department of the treasury.  The bill also provides that
 42 30 a violation of this Code section shall subject the permittee
 42 31 to the general penalties provided in Code chapter 123 and the
 42 32 suspension, revocation, and civil penalty provisions of Code
 42 33 section 123.39.
